perturbation.original_text: 1.1 AGREEMENT TO OUTSOURCE CARE MANAGEMENT SERVICES. HPS agrees to outsource to SHPS, and hereby appoints SHPS as the exclusive provider of, Care Management Services to the Clients, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement. SHPS shall provide the Care Management Services directly to the Clients in accordance with the terms of the Client Agreements. "Care Management Services" means the business of providing utilization review (which includes, but is not limited to, pre-admission certification, prior authorization, prospective length of stay approvals, second opinions, concurrent review and discharge planning), catastrophic medical case management, disease management and demand management (24 hours per day, 7 days per week) services to benefits payors and health providers, in all cases in accordance with the terms of the applicable Client Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 AGREEMENT TO OUTSOURCE CARE MANAGEMENT SERVICES. HPS agrees to outsource to SHPS, and hereby appoints SHPS as a provider of, Care Management Services to the Clients, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement. SHPS may provide the Care Management Services directly to some Clients in accordance with mutually agreed-upon terms. "Care Management Services" means the business of providing utilization review (which includes, but is not limited to, pre-admission certification, prior authorization, prospective length of stay approvals, second opinions, concurrent review and discharge planning), catastrophic medical case management, disease management and demand management services to benefits payors and health providers, in some cases in accordance with the terms of the applicable Client Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states SHPS is the 'exclusive provider' and 'shall provide' services directly. The modification removes 'exclusive' and changes 'shall provide' to 'may provide', making SHPS's obligation to provide services directly to all clients optional, creating a contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: 2.2 CALCULATION OF CARE MANAGEMENT REVENUES. "Care Management Revenues" means, with respect to any month during the term, the revenues collected by HPS from Clients (or new Clients, as applicable) for the Care Management Services. Monthly revenues for Care Management Services shall be calculated based on a per employee per month fee equal to: (i) the amount (as of the date of this Agreement) set forth in the applicable Client Agreement (including hourly medical case management fees); or (ii) if the Client Agreement does not include a per employee per month fee for Care Management Services, $2.00 (this amount shall apply to all individual and small group business). Prospectively, for new Clients, SHPS and HPS shall agree to the rate HPS will offer to such new Clients (including hourly medical case management fees).
perturbation.changed_text: 2.2 CALCULATION OF CARE MANAGEMENT REVENUES. "Care Management Revenues" means, with respect to any month during the term, the revenues collected by HPS from Clients (or new Clients, as applicable) for certain Care Management Services deemed appropriate by HPS. Monthly revenues for Care Management Services will be calculated based on a per employee per month fee equal to: (i) the amount (as of the date of this Agreement) set forth in the applicable Client Agreement (including hourly medical case management fees); or (ii) if the Client Agreement does not include a per employee per month fee for Care Management Services, $2.00 (this amount shall apply to all individual and small group business) or any other rate HPS decides is applicable. Prospectively, for new Clients, HPS shall solely determine the rate it will offer to such new Clients (including hourly medical case management fees).
perturbation.explanation: The original text bases revenue calculation on pre-defined amounts and requires mutual agreement for new clients. The modification allows HPS to decide which Care Management Services are included, and gives HPS sole discretion over the rate offered to new clients, including applying 'any other rate', conflicting with the initial fixed amounts and the need for SHPS's agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 4.2 BINDING NATURE AND ASSIGNMENT. This Agreement shall be binding on the parties and their respective successors and assigns, but neither party may, or shall have the power to, assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2 BINDING NATURE AND ASSIGNMENT. This Agreement shall be binding on the parties and their respective successors and assigns, but neither party may, or shall have the power to, assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other, which consent may be withheld at the assigning party's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires consent for assignment, which cannot be 'unreasonably withheld'. The modification allows the assigning party to withhold consent at their 'sole discretion', which contradicts the original condition of not unreasonably withholding consent. This creates uncertainty about the circumstances under which assignment is permissible.
